Text: Say, over there, is that her? That Shiron girl?

Yeah, that's her. She's really got the world wrapped
around her finger. All she has to do is be the
slightest bit cute and everyone goes her way.

But they say that she's actually quite...*whisper*
She's just a flash in the pan, though. Everyone'll
get sick of her once her 15 minutes are up.

(Uhh, you do know I can hear you, right? Then again,
they probably want me to overhear what they're
saying.)

A concert sponsored by a certain aristocrat in the
Oriana Kingdom. The green room is abuzz with the
chatter of up-and-coming musicians.

All of the chatter was about the pianist Shiron—aka
the public persona of Epsilon, one of the Seven
Shadows.

(If one were to name the most popular artists of the
moment here in Oriana, my name would be right at the
top of the list. They must be jealous.)

(If a musician can gain the backing of a powerful
patron in a nation of the arts like this one, they're
almost guaranteed a life of luxury regardless of
ancestry...)

(Heehee, there's no way they can't be envious of
someone who has both beauty and talent like
yours truly...)

(One person's rise means another person's fall, so it
really is a matter of life and death. I can understand
why they'd be hostile towards anyone young and pretty
who comes along.)

(No telling how many artists have lost the favor of
their patron and met ruin in the blink of an eye.
It's pretty much like being cast down from heaven
into hell—quite the cruel system indeed.)

(Still, I do feel sorry for these people, living life
constantly trying to tear down any perceived
competition...)

(...Not that I'm trying to sympathize with any of
you, especially since I have no obligation to let
any of you mock me!)
*sigh* It's so difficult being young and pretty.
*gasp*
Oh, did I say that out loud? Heehee.
The air in the anteroom bristled.
(Oh, did you think I wouldn't bite back?)

(Well, too bad. I'm afraid you'll have to come up
with something meaner than that to make me
crumble.)

(After all, I have absolute confidence in the skills
and songs my beloved lord has taught me.)

(So let's get this straight: you hags will never beat
me. Not in beauty, or in musical ability.)

Epsilon cast a triumphant gaze toward the woman who
had been running her mouth. Her expression was so
smug that it fanned the flames even further.
Excuse me, Shiron, was it?
I beg your pardon, but did you hear me?!

Oh, were you speaking to me? I thought that was the
squealing of a broken door.

*gasp* Y-You dare compare my pristine voice to a
broken door?!

Oh, how dreadfully frightening. This is the issue
with those who don't understand social graces.
(...Aha, the alpha female appears.)

(It was her circle that's been doing all that nasty
whispering. And now the ringleader finally takes
the stage. Not that I'm happy to see her.)

Dear me, no need to make such a scary face. We simply
thought we might give you a lesson in etiquette.

That's quite all right. I know all I need to know
about etiquette.

Don't be such a poor sport. What passes for common
sense in the countryside isn't acceptable here in
capital city, you know.

We wouldn't want you to embarrass yourself, now would
we?

(Ugh, I can't stand her. Nobody asked for your help,
lady. So what, badmouthing someone behind
their back is good manners? What a joke.)

Oh my, there's that scowl again. No gentleman will
ever take a fancy to you looking like that, my dear.

Don't worry about me, there are more than a few men
who find even my meanest look beautiful.
Grr...!

Th-That reminds me...is it not nearly time for your
performance? Perhaps you should go get changed.

Heehee, why thank you for the advice. However,
I'm fine as I am.

My, you mean to take the stage in THAT dress? Many
members of distinguished families are in attendance
at this concert, so I'd think you would want to wear
something a little less plain.
Why, I had assumed that was your dressing gown.
The remark prompted giggles from all around.

(Look at the smug "Oh dear, did I just say that?"
face. I suppose she thinks she really got one over
on me.)

(Yes, yes, I don't know which of you did it, but when
I opened my closet, I found the dress I planned to
wear today sliced to ribbons.)

(They even went to the trouble of putting needles in
my shoes...)

*sigh*... I'd almost forgotten that this is the way
of things in upper-class society.

Epsilon had a pampered upbringing in Elvenland,
so she was no stranger to this.

It would be the easiest thing in the world to return
the favor in kind, but I'm afraid that would mean
stooping to your level. Now if you'll excuse me.
Wh-What did you just say?!

Epsilon sat herself calmly at the piano, all too
aware of the aristocrats watching her.

(I don't need fancy dresses or gaudy jewels. I know I
can dazzle an audience without them.)

(And there's only one song I can open with,
of course... "Moonlight Sonata".)

Epsilon begins to play the melody of the song she
knows best, and that she loves the most.

(The best way to deal with those only capable of
childish tricks is to grind them into the ground
with sheer talent.)
(Just...as I am about to do now.)

No sooner had Epsilon started to play than night
fell. Quiet, darkness, and the gentle light of the
moon filled the space.

(It was the same when I first heard my lord play this
song. The melody instantly transformed what had been
a dull, empty room into a space more grand than any
temple.)

(And what filled that stately space was moonlight,
a radiance that does not lose its luster or dignity
even in darkness...no, it stands out all the more
because of it!)

(In that moment, I saw a ray of the moon's light
shining bright and clear. My lord, does my
performance resemble yours back then even
a little?)

(Will the gleaming moonlight be enough to move the
hearts of those in this hall?)

There was a brief silence after Epsilon finished
playing. The tension suddenly left her, and she
looked about slowly to gauge the reaction of the
audience.

(So? Was my heartfelt playing enough to impress you?
I only wish my lord could've been here to see it.)

Speechless. Stunned. Various reactions could be seen
on the faces of those in attendance.

Scattered clapping could be heard, and this soon
opened the gates to a flood of thunderous applause
that eventually became a standing ovation.
Heehee... I win again.

A proud smile rose on Epsilon's face as she basked in
the adulation of the audience.
